p: The recognition of Aspergillus conidia induces the expression of proinflammatory chemokines and cytokines [10;11]. In line with previous results, we observed that the complete deficiency of the receptor was associated with decreased Aspergillus-induced pro-inflammatory cytokine responses. The production of CXCL1, IL-1β, TNF, and IL-6 was decreased in the lungs of Trem1 −/- mice at early stages on the infection (2 dpi). Time course pro-inflammatory cytokine profiles in Trem1 +/+ mice ( Figure 6), followed the same pattern than the detection of sTREM1 ( Figure 3a). While pro-inflammatory cytokines and sTREM1 levels decreased at 3 dpi, the number of immune cell was still increasing ( Figure 4). These findings agree with the hypothesis that this soluble form can be neutralizing the production of cytokines [ 29] but it does not mediate a direct effect in the influx of immune cells.
